title: Expand file upload to accept any file type

requirements.text: Remove the file type restriction on the upload page that currently limits uploads to images and videos only, allowing users to upload any file type

quotes: I only want one thing. Right now it can share media files perfectly. But I'd like it to now share any file.

acceptanceCriteria: File picker accepts all file types without MIME type restrictions
No validation error appears for non-media files (PDFs, documents, ZIP files, etc.)
The 2MB file size limit remains enforced for all file types

requirements.text: Update the upload page UI text and messaging to reflect that any file type can be uploaded, not just media files

quotes: I only want one thing. Right now it can share media files perfectly. But I'd like it to now share any file.

acceptanceCriteria: Upload instructions mention 'any file' or 'all file types' instead of 'images and videos'
File type validation messages are removed or updated to be file-type agnostic

requirements.text: Ensure the share page handles preview display appropriately for non-media files by showing file metadata and download button without attempting to render previews for unsupported file types
acceptanceCriteria: Non-media files (PDFs, documents, etc.) display filename, size, and download button without breaking
Image and video previews continue to work as before
No console errors appear when viewing non-media file share pages

constraints: Maintain the existing 2MB file size limit
Keep all existing file sharing and download functionality intact
Preserve the chunked upload mechanism for backend storage
nonGoals: Increasing the file size limit beyond 2MB
Adding file type-specific previews for documents or PDFs
Modifying the backend file storage or chunking logic
Changing the file sharing URL structure or access control
